docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: All winter, especially on days when pollution readings reached record levels, the 20 million inhabitants of this metropolis longed for spring. April, with its normally refreshing winds, has finally arrived, yet there is no relief in sight.

headline.main: Mexico City's Filthy Air, World's Worst, Worsens

docs.snippet: LEAD: All winter, especially on days when pollution readings reached record levels, the 20 million inhabitants of this metropolis longed for spring. April, with its normally refreshing winds, has finally arrived, yet there is no relief in sight.

byline.original: By LARRY ROHTER, Special to the New York Times
